title.rendered: 16 Best eCommerce CMS Platforms to Build Your Online Store

content.rendered:
Building an eCommerce website shouldn’t feel like building a Pyramid. eCommerce CMS platforms make it easy to manage and edit content without coding knowledge.

But reality hits when you try to find the best eCommerce CMS Solution. We have been there and researched and searched endlessly on Google!

Guess what we found- The best out of the best ones! So, it’s time to stop feeling overwhelmed and start feeling overjoyed, as this blog will look into some of the best Multi Vendor CMS options out there for eCommerce business owners. 

By reading till the end of this blog, you will know which platform to use to create your online store because we will dive into the details of every single platform. 

Key Takeaways

  • An eCommerce CMS lets you manage your entire online store from product listings to orders, payments, and customer data all in one place.
  • Look for must-have features like easy product management, secure checkout, SEO tools, mobile responsiveness, and built-in analytics before choosing a CMS.
  • Best CMS for ecommerce platforms include WooCommerce, Shopify, Magento, and 6Valley, each serving different business sizes, goals, and budgets.
  • To choose the right CMS, consider your tech skills, business size, budget, and need for customization.

What is eCommerce CMS? 

An eCommerce CMS is a software that helps you create and manage your online store without having coding knowledge.

With an eCommerce content management system (CMS), you can add, change, edit, and design your online store to sell products easily. 

Benefits of Using a CMS for Online Stores

So what does it bring for an online store? Let me explain – 

  • Easy product and content updates – Add or change items anytime without technical help
  • Faster website launch – Start selling without building everything from zero
  • Built-in SEO tools – Helps your store show up on Google
  • Mobile-friendly designs – Ready-made templates that look great on any device
  • Flexible payment integrations – Add payment options your customers trust
  • Order and customer management – Track orders and keep your customers happy in one place
  • Scalable as you grow – Upgrade features as your business expands
  • Secure and reliable – Most CMS platforms come with built-in protection

Now before diving into the details of the platforms, it’s important to know what features make a CMS Software great among all. So here it goes-

Must Have Features of eCommerce CMS

Like a strong foundation is crucial for a building, a solid start is essential for your eCommerce store.  It’s important to focus on specific features that can help you improve your website’s visibility and make your journey easier.

Below are the must-have features you should consider while choosing the eCommerce content management system (CMS). 

Product Management

This is the heart of your store, so make sure your CMS allows you to – 

  • Add, edit, and delete products
  • Inventory control
  • Product categories and filtering

Content Management

To keep your website fresh and informative, your CMS should let you:

  • Add and edit blog posts or pages
  • Upload images, videos, and product descriptions
  • Create landing pages for promotions or campaigns
  • Manage all your content from one place without coding

Order Management

A smooth order process keeps your customers happy. Look for:

  • A dashboard to view and manage orders
  • Real-time order tracking
  • Easy order status updates (processing, shipped, delivered)
  • Automated emails for order confirmation and shipping updates

Marketing and SEO 

To promote your business and attract more customers, you need these features: 

  • Search Engine Optimization (SEO) tools
  • Email marketing integration
  • Promotion and discounts

Secure Payment Process

To build trust and give customers an easy way to order from your business, you need: 

  • Integration option for multiple payment gateways
  • Multiple payment options

User-Friendly Interface

An easily optimizable user-friendly interface ensures a smooth experience for visitors with the following: 

  • Drag and drop functionality
  • Customizable templates or themes 
  • User-friendly dashboard 
  • Optimized for mobile devices 

Customer Management

To build strong customer relationships, look for these features in the CMS platform:

  • Customer account
  • Order tracking
  • Wishlist functionality 
  • Reward programs 

Analytics and Reporting

Gain valuable insight into your store’s performance by having access to: 

  • Sales reporting
  • Customer behavior analysis 
  • Website visitors analysis

Security 

Protect your customers’ data with advanced security features like: 

  • SSL encryption
  • PCI compliance 
  • Regular security updates and backups

Types of Content Management Systems

Before we dive into the detailed list of eCommerce CMS platforms, let’s first understand the different types of eCommerce CMS solutions available. 

This section will help you to have a clear idea about different types of content management systems to choose the one that aligns with your business needs. 

Open Source CMS 

These platforms are built on publicly accessible source code. That means you can modify and redistribute it freely. 

For example, think of it as you’re building your dream house from scratch where you have the flexibility and control over design and construction. Just for this, you need some skills. 

Characteristics: 

  • Community-driven development
  • Flexibility for customization
  • Wide range of plugins and extensions

Examples: WordPress, Joomla, Drupal

Saas CMS

It provides a cloud based solution for website development through a monthly subscription model. These solutions are owned and managed by specific companies. They charge their users for accessing their services. Even though the customization option isn’t as flexible as other types of CMS it comes with content creation tools, templates, and hosting services.

Characteristics: 

  • Monthly subscription model
  • Owned and maintained by specific companies 
  • Cloud-hosted web development interface 

Examples: HubSpot (CMS Hub), Shopify 

Custom Built CMS

These are tailored solutions developed specifically for individual projects or businesses. It requires significant investment and technical expertise to build and maintain. If you have a long-term plan for your eCommerce website then you can consider this one. 

Characteristics:

  • Unique features and functionalities
  • Full control over design and architecture
  • Higher development costs and longer time to market

Examples: In-house developed systems, solutions built by web development agencies for their clients

Pre-built CMS

These platforms are ready-made solutions that come with complete and market-ready  templates & features to launch business immediately. It doesn’t require extensive development knowledge. 

Characteristics:

  • Ready-to-use templates and themes
  • Quick setup and deployment
  • Lower cost compared to custom development

Examples: 6Valley – a complete multivendor eCommerce CMS that helps you kickstart and grow your business. It is equipped with all the necessary eCommerce panels and apps that make running an online store a breeze. You can use it to handle everything from inventory management to payment processing without any hassle. It’s the perfect solution for anyone looking to start or scale their eCommerce business.

Proprietary CMS

This type of CMS is owned by a company and comes with a license. You pay to use it, but you don’t own or control the code.

It’s perfect if you want a managed experience and don’t need deep customization.

Characteristics:

  • Owned by a single company
  • Limited flexibility for changes
  • Usually includes support and updates

Examples: Adobe Experience Manager, Sitecore

Headless CMS

A modern and flexible type of CMS where the content is stored in the backend, but the frontend (website or app) is built separately.

It’s like having the content engine separated from the website design. It is perfect for businesses that want full creative control or need to show content across multiple platforms (like apps, websites, kiosks, etc.).

Characteristics:

  • Backend content management only
  • Frontend can be built with any technology
  • Great for omnichannel experiences

Examples: Contentful, Strapi, Sanity

1. WordPress + WooCommerce 

It is simple and the best open source CMS for ecommerce websites that is available online. It allows you to build a fully functional eCommerce shop with the help of plugins and themes. As it is an open-source CMS platform you won’t have to get worried about your wallet while using the basic technology this platform offers with many free themes.

Using the popular open source plugin WooCommerce with WordPress you can build a successful eCommerce business. The simplicity of installation and customization made it one of the major platforms for building eCommerce stores today.

Features:

  • Wide range of customizable themes and templates
  • Built-in SEO features to optimize for SERP visibility
  • Track the site’s performance with Jetpack Stats or Google Analytics for advanced reporting and eCommerce metrics.
  • Sell a wide range of physical and digital products using WooCommerce
  • Social media integration option
  • It is available in multiple languages, making it accessible to users worldwide
  • Jetpack Protect Plugin ensures your site is secured
  • Integrating WooCommerce with your WordPress site is free of charge, offering added value without extra cost

Pros:

  • Free and user-friendly platform to start a business without hassle.
  • Multiple payment and shipping options to build trust and connection with audiences.
  • It is possible to integrate with popular marketing platforms to promote and extend your business.
  • Built-in SEO features in WooCommerce for organic traffic and better SERP ranking

Cons:

  • Some plugins could be unstable or insecure and risk your site’s safety.
  • WordPress lacks built-in eCommerce features like Shopify does. That’s why you need to use WooCommerce with it for building a complete eCommerce CMS. 
  • Without WordPress, you can not use WooCommerce 
  • While the core WooCommerce plugin is free, certain advanced features and extensions come at an additional cost. 
  • Dealing with lots of plugins can be confusing and harder to manage in WordPress.

Integration Options: 

  • Multiple payment gateways
  • Social media integration
  • Affiliate marketing plugin 
  • Third-party extensions
  • Analytics tools and many more. 

Customization Options:

WordPress eCommerce platform users can customize the design, layout functionality, and features for their online stores. The plugin WooCommerce allows customization options for a user to meet their specific needs with their sites. 

Pricing: 

Basic: Free (but no domain) 

Biggest Clients:

  • PlayStation.Blog
  • Time Magazine
  • Porter and York
  • Spotify Newsroom

2. Shopify

Shopify is a complete eCommerce CMS platform. It offers an effortless way to build and maintain your eCommerce platform. With Shopify, you have a 3-day free trial option to check whether it fits your business or not. Even if you have no background in coding, you can easily set up your store. There are plenty of professional-looking themes for you to choose from.

Features:

  • Simple store management procedure through a user-friendly interface
  • Secure transaction option
  • Built-in marketing tools for promotion and reaching a wider range of  audience 
  • International selling option for expanding market reach
  • Mobile app for both Android and iOS users to manage business from one place 

Pros: 

  • 24/7 customer support
  • Comes with a POS system for multi vendor, single vendor, and events for managing payment processing, staff, inventory, and customers.
  • Integrated security features like SSL encryption, protection against DDoS attacks, and adherence to PCI DSS compliance standards.

Cons:

  • Advanced features may require additional costs for app purchases
  • Monthly subscription fees might be expensive for new and small business owners

Integration Options: 

  • Email marketing tools
  • Social media channels
  • Content marketing
  • Affiliate Program
  • Ads and retargeting, and many more. 

Customization Options:

Shopify eCommerce CMS platform offers extensive customization options for your store. Such as visual alteration options, charging users for using premium options, date and font picker, etc. 

Pricing:

Basic: $19/month

Advanced: $299 /month

Biggest Clients:

  • Netflix Shop
  • Heinz To Home

3. Magento / Adobe Commerce

Magento is an Open Source eCommerce CMS platform Solution that helps to create online stores with minimal features for free. However, for web development, hosting, and other necessary integration, you will need to pay. As Adobe now owns it, it also goes with the Adobe Commerce name. It is an seo friendly content management system adopted by many eCommerce business owners due to its flexibility and robustness.

Features:

  • Manage both your B2B and B2C sites from one single interface. 
  • Easy integration of third-party services.
  • SEO-friendly URLs for better search engine visibility.
  • Integrated with Google Analytics for detailed insights
  • Different price range setting options for various customer groups like wholesalers and retailers. 

Pros:

  • SEO-friendly CMS with fast loading of websites
  • Option to build a convenient mobile-friendly storefront for customers
  • SSL security support for both frontend and backend orders

Cons:

  • Requires programming knowledge to build site
  • Higher development and maintenance cost

Integration Options:

  • Custom coding
  • Third-party integration and more.

Customization Options:

Magento allows users to customize themes and templates, add customizable layouts, and use extensions and modules for their online stores.

Pricing:

Open Source: Free

Biggest Clients:

  • Olympus
  • Ford

4. 6Valley

It is a Complete Laravel eCommerce CMS Solution with multi vendor and single vendor business modes. With 6Valley you can organize multiple shops like digital stores, sports stores, home and living stores, etc under one platform. It is considered one of the best cms for online stores. This multi vendor CMS is fully mobile-optimized to give users the best experience possible. It’s a complete and market-ready e-commerce CMS solution that anyone can use to launch their eCommerce business and manage the system without being a pro programmer.

Get 6Valley Now

Features:

  • Manage your business in both single vendor and multi vendor modules from one platform. 
  • Can sell both digital and physical products 
  • Comes with international shipping support 
  • All the apps are available for both Android and iOS
  • Multiple themes for different business needs and choices 

Key Differences with other CMS: Along with the essential web panels, 6Vallley comes with a User App, Seller App, and Deliveryman App that supports both Android and iOS devices. So unlike other CMSs, you won’t have to bear the hassle of launching or developing different mobile apps from scratch. You’re getting all of it within this launch-ready solution. 

Pros: 

  • Comes with 2 super web panels and 3 mobile applications to offer the complete and market-ready solution
  • Option to sell both in-house and other sellers’ products from one platform
  • Both online and offline payment methods make it convenient for business owners and users. 
  • Without any extra plugins and extensions you can run your eCommerce business smoothly 

Cons: 

  • Deliveryman app is an addon

Integration Options: 

  • Multiple payment methods
  • Social media platforms
  • Google Map APIs 
  • Mail and SMS Configuration
  • Recaptcha and many more

Customization Options:

6Valley is a fully customizable multi vendor CMS that allows you to make your brand and business website unique. With 6Valley you have full control to customize the system either by yourself or by taking expert help from their active support team.

Regular license: $79

6. Drupal

Drupal is one of the most widely used e-commerce content management systems (CMS) Solutions, even if not specifically designed for eCommerce. It allows combining different plugins and frameworks to enable functionalities for an eCommerce website. This open-source system works as a framework to build a website rather than a comprehensive website builder.

Features:

  • Easy content creation with a user-friendly interface and WYSIWYG editor.
  • Multi-language support with over 100 languages available.
  • Drag-and-drop layout customization without code editing.
  • Real time SEO to optimize Drupal posts as you create them 
  • Regularly updated security features to protect against attacks and bugs.

Pros:

  • Highly customizable and flexible platform.
  • Strong community support and extensive documentation.
  • Scalable for handling large and complex websites.      

Cons:

  • Requires basic technical expertise to set up and customization
  • Customizing requires expert developers’ help or help from Drupal Partners 
  • Steeper learning curve compared to other CMS platforms

Integration Options:

  • HubSpot Integration
  • Shorten URLs and many more

Customization Options:

Yes, Drupal eCommerce CMS allows customization through various modules, themes, etc to meet specific business needs and branding requirements. 

Pricing:

Free of charge 

Biggest Clients:

  • Tesla
  • Pfizer

BigCommerce delivers fast shopping experiences, bringing your website’s customers back for more. It is also a popular CMS for Online eCommerce Shop Website.

  • Manage the catalog by organizing your products with unlimited categories and subcategories 
  • Multi currency option provides automatic rate updates
  • Translation option in any language to expand in new markets

16. Zen Cart 

Zen Cart is a versatile, open source ecommerce CMS software, and one of the most popular eCommerce CMS. It serves diverse business needs by providing support for multiple languages, currencies, and hosting providers.  Due to its open-source nature, it is required to have some technical knowledge.

Features:

  • Manage meta tags keywords and descriptions for each product directly from the admin interface.
  • Optimized for viewing on various devices, including tablets and smartphones.
  • Products can be linked or copied to multiple categories for easier organization.
  • Configure the Contact Us page to support multiple destinations such as Sales, Technical Support, and Webmaster.
  • Easily configure tax rates, tax zones, and other tax-related settings in the admin area.

Pros:

  • High customization capabilities
  • Seamless payment gateway integration for immediate transactions

Which is the Best eCommerce CMS for Your Online Store?

Choosing the best eCommerce CMS for your online store truly depends on your unique business needs. There isn’t one perfect answer, as the ideal eCommerce platform for you will be different from others. To find the right fit, think about your budget, how much tech experience you have, the features you need, and how much you expect your business to grow.

For example, Shopify is often great for beginners who want something easy to use. If you need a lot of control and are comfortable with more technical work, WooCommerce (with WordPress) could be an excellent choice. BigCommerce offers strong tools for businesses planning to scale up quickly.

Ultimately, the best eCommerce solution is one that helps you manage your products, process payments securely, market your store effectively, and grow your business with ease.

Now if you feel overwhelmed reading all this information all at once and need a comprehensive idea based on different business goals then the table below is made for you: 

How to Choose the Right eCommerce CMS?

Picking the right CMS for your online store can feel tricky. Here’s a simple checklist to help you make a smart choice:

Know Your Business Needs and Goals

First, think about what you want to sell. Are they physical products, digital items, or services? How many products do you have? Also, how big do you expect your store to get in the next few years? Your budget is important too – how much can you spend on the platform each month or year?

Think About Your Tech Skills

If you do not have any coding skills and you don’t want to invest in a development agency, then it’s better to go for a beginner-friendly platform or a readymade solution. If you have a dev team or access to one, then open source platforms help in extensive customization. 

Check Your Budget

SaaS platforms come with monthly costs but offer ease and support. Open-source platforms are free to start, but you’ll need to pay for hosting, plugins, and development.

Look for Essential Features

Check all the must have features mentioned in this blog and make sure to tick all of them while going for a particular eCommerce CMS. 

Try Before You Buy

Most good eCommerce CMS platforms offer a free trial. Use it! Set up a test store, add some products, and see how easy it is to use. This hands-on experience is key to finding your best fit. Also, read what other users say in reviews. Their experiences can teach you a lot.

Check Scalability

If you plan to grow fast or expand globally, choose a CMS that can handle more traffic, products, and advanced features later when your business expands.

Availability of Customer Support 

If something goes wrong anywhere in your journey of using eCommerce CMS, you will need help fast. That’s why an active and expert support group is important, as well as having access to tutorials and community support.

Common Mistakes to Avoid When Choosing a CMS

Choosing the right Content Management System (CMS) is one of the most important decisions for your online store. A good CMS will save you time, improve your website’s performance, and help you grow your business. Here are the mistakes that you should be avoiding: 

  • Picking a CMS because it’s popular, not because it fits your needs.
  • Assuming a “free” CMS means no hidden costs.
  • Choosing a complex CMS without considering your technical skills or resources for tech support. 
  • Selecting a CMS that can’t handle increased traffic or products.
  • Assuming all CMS platforms are equally secure.
  • Forgetting that SEO and marketing are key to attracting customers.
  • Skipping the mobile optimization feature of the chosen CMS. 

Future Trends in eCommerce CMS Platforms

The eCommerce world is moving fast, and so are CMS platforms. If you’re planning to launch or grow an online store, it’s important to know where things are headed.

One major trend is AI-powered personalization. CMS tools are getting smarter. They now track what users browse, click, and buy. 

Another big shift is headless commerce. This setup separates the backend from the front end, giving you full design freedom.

Voice commerce is also growing. More shoppers are using voice assistants like Alexa and Google to search or place orders. So, CMS platforms are starting to support voice search and conversational buying features.

Since most people shop on their phones, CMS platforms are focusing on mobile-first design and supporting Progressive Web Apps (PWAs).

Another trend is omnichannel integration. Shoppers want a smooth experience across websites, social media, and apps. Many CMS platforms now support features like Instagram shopping, live sales, and one-click social checkout.

Lastly, more CMS platforms are building in AI chatbots and automated support tools. These bots help with order tracking, product questions, and basic support.
